title: For Covid-19 Vaccine Doses, Should There Be More Time Between Shots?
sub_head: Waiting longer between shots can build better immunity, studies suggest, but the risk calculus is tricky
body: Two-dose vaccines are typically spaced months and sometimes years apart to provide long-lasting protection from disease. As children begin to get their Covid-19 shots, emerging research in adults suggests that waiting longer between doses could have similar benefits.
